alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 10:21AM EST until February 26 at 10:51AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. For the Cumberland River...including Cumberland, Baxter, Pineville, Barbourville, Williamsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Manchester Street and Miller Road east of US 25 E flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 28.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Friday was 28.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.8 feet Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday night. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.8 feet on 03/19/1949. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 7 PM on Friday, February 25th.
